H3079.def: = man, also known as {L:Eliakim<SDBH:אֶלְיָקִים>}; ◄ son of {L:Josiah<SDBH:יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► king of Judah (609-597), appointed by Pharaoh {L:Necoh<SDBH:נְכֹה>}, who changed his name from Eliakim to Jehoiakim

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

71.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H5012.def: = action by which humans speak or act as a prophet

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H223.def: = man; ◄ {L:Hittite<SDBH:חִתִּי>}; ► warrior; husband of {L:Bathsheba<SDBH:בַּת־שֶׁבַע>}; killed on the authority of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H7157.def: = town, also known as {L:Kiriath-Baal<SDBH:קִרְיַת־בַּעַל>}, {L:Baalah<SDBH:בַּעֲלָה>}, and {L:Baale-Judah<SDBH:בַּעֲלֵי יְהוּדָה>}; ◄ located in the {L:hill country<SDBH:הַר>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► one of the four {L:Hivite<SDBH:חִוִּי>} cities that made a covenant with {L:Joshua<SDBH:יְהֹושׁוּעַ>}

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3079.def: = man, also known as {L:Eliakim<SDBH:אֶלְיָקִים>}; ◄ son of {L:Josiah<SDBH:יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► king of Judah (609-597), appointed by Pharaoh {L:Necoh<SDBH:נְכֹה>}, who changed his name from Eliakim to Jehoiakim

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H223.def: = man; ◄ {L:Hittite<SDBH:חִתִּי>}; ► warrior; husband of {L:Bathsheba<SDBH:בַּת־שֶׁבַע>}; killed on the authority of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H494.def: = man; ◄ father of {L:Nehushta<SDBH:נְחֻשְׁתָּא>}, wife of king {L:Jehoiakim<SDBH:יְהֹויָקִים>}

H5907.def: = man; ► father of {L:Baal-Hanan<SDBH:בַּעַל חָנָן>}, king of {L:Edom<SDBH:אֱדֹום>}

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H223.def: = man; ◄ {L:Hittite<SDBH:חִתִּי>}; ► warrior; husband of {L:Bathsheba<SDBH:בַּת־שֶׁבַע>}; killed on the authority of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3079.def: = man, also known as {L:Eliakim<SDBH:אֶלְיָקִים>}; ◄ son of {L:Josiah<SDBH:יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► king of Judah (609-597), appointed by Pharaoh {L:Necoh<SDBH:נְכֹה>}, who changed his name from Eliakim to Jehoiakim

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H5038.def: = the dead body of humans or animals

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H296.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shaphan<SDBH:שָׁפָן>}; ► official; time of king {L:Josiah<SDBH:יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ>}; father of {L:Gedaliah<SDBH:גְּדַלְיָהוּ>}, governor of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, time of exile

H8227.def: = Syrian Rock Hyrax; animal with small round ears, no visible tail, and short legs, lives on leaves and herbs; two of their front teeth develop into small tusks; can run up almost vertical rock faces and climb trees with ease; ◄ procavia capensis syriaca; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with small size and wisdom

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1115.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
